  1. City Of Temecula Planning Commission Positions Available

    The Temecula City Council invites interested residents of the City of Temecula to apply for two positions on the Planning Commission. Read on...

  2. LOVE Temecula!

    Share your LOVE Temecula! Read on...

  3. 17th Annual Third Grade History Contest Winning Entries on Display at the Temecula Valley Museum

    The Temecula Valley Museum is delighted to showcase the creative and intelligent minds of our youth through the Annual Third Grade History Contest & Exhibit! Read on...

  4. Teen Night Light Egg Hunt

    Grab your friends and your flashlight, so you’ll be prepared to collect egg-citing prizes at the annual teen only egg hunt. Read on...

  5. Around & About Temecula - Episode Thirteen

    The City of Temecula Community Services Department’s monthly Web series, Around & About Temecula, captures the look and feel of living in the City of Temecula. Read on...

  1. Current News

  1. The City of Temecula Presents Temecula Business Week 2019 - April 15th -19th

    Temecula Business Week, April 15th - April 19th, 2019. Read on...

  2. City Of Temecula Planning Commission Positions Available

    The Temecula City Council invites interested residents of the City of Temecula to apply for two positions on the Planning Commission. Read on...

  3. 7th Annual Light It Up Blue for Autism Awareness Month Presented by the City of Temecula

    The City of Temecula in association with Our Nicholas Foundation will Light it Up Blue to commemorate Autism Awareness for the month of April on Tuesday, April 2, 2019 at City Hall (41000 Main Street). Read on...

  4. City of Temecula Mayor Mike Naggar Hosts Inclusive Workforce Luncheon on Tuesday, April 23, 2019

    The City of Temecula will host the Mayor’s Inclusive Workforce Luncheon, Making Success Accessible To All, on Tuesday, April 23, 2019 from 11:30 am – 1:30 pm at the Temecula Conference Center (41000 Main Street). Read on...

  5. The City of Temecula Announces Vinduino as Innovator of the Year

    This year, the City of Temecula was pleased to announce Vinduino, LLC as “Innovator of the Year” during Innovation Month in April. Read on...

  6. City of Temecula Police Department is Seeking Tips from the Public

    The Temecula Police Department and the Riverside County Sheriff’s Department, Central Homicide Unit, continue to seek tips from the public regarding the tragic loss of Larry Robinson.

  1. Temecula Hosts 11th Annual Special Games at Great Oak High School Football Stadium on May 4, 2019

    Attention Superheroes: This is your chance to have some fun and be your very best! Read on...

  2. Applications Available Online NOW for the City of Temecula’s 4th of July Extravaganza

    The City of Temecula will host the Annual 4th of July Extravaganza on Thursday, July 4, 2019 beginning with the Star-Spangled 4th of July Parade in Old Town Temecula and ending with Festivities & Fireworks Show at the Ronald Reagan Sports Park. Read on...

  3. Temecula Sister City Association Sends Ten Local Students on a Cultural Adventure to Daisen, Japan

    Ten local middle school students are spending their Spring Break in Temecula’s Sister City, Daisen, Japan! Read on...

  4. Attend Special Sister City Edition of Monthly Second Saturday Program at the Temecula Valley Museum

    The Netherlands will be the celebrated culture during the Second Saturday program at the Temecula Valley Museum on April 13, 2019, in honor of the City of Temecula’s Sister City, Leidschendam-Voorburg, in the Netherlands. Read on...

  5. Making CONNECTIONS: Linking Music and the World Around Us at the Old Town Temecula Community Theater

    Temecula Presents in association with the California Chamber Orchestra present the 2018-2019 Classical Music Series. Read on...

  6. Temecula Community Services Department Earns Three 2018 Awards of Excellence

    The City of Temecula earned three Awards of Excellence from the California Park & Recreation Society (CPRS) on Friday, March 22, 2019 in Sacramento. Read on...

  1. Events
  1. Apr 11

  2. Jazz at The Merc

    Each Thursday (and special performance dates throughout the year), you will be treated to a different jazz group in the intimate space known as "The Merc". The Mercantile is one of Temecula's original buildings and has been beautifully restored. We wanted to take advantage of this venue and bring you straight ahead jazz every Thursday evening in this acoustically inspired space.

  3. All Shook Up

    Elvis Presley Music Book by Joe DiPietro Through Special Arrangement with Theatrical Rights Worldwide 2019 An American jukebox musical featuring the songs of Elvis Presley and based on William Shakespeare's play Twelfth Night. It’s 1955, and into a square little town in a square little state rides a guitar-playing young man who changes everything and everyone he meets in this hip-swiveling, lip-curling musical fantasy that’ll have you jumpin’ out of your blue suede shoes with such classics...
  1. Apr 12

  2. All Shook Up

    Elvis Presley Music Book by Joe DiPietro Through Special Arrangement with Theatrical Rights Worldwide 2019 An American jukebox musical featuring the songs of Elvis Presley and based on William Shakespeare's play Twelfth Night. It’s 1955, and into a square little town in a square little state rides a guitar-playing young man who changes everything and everyone he meets in this hip-swiveling, lip-curling musical fantasy that’ll have you jumpin’ out of your blue suede shoes with such classics...

  3. Teen Night Light Egg Hunt

    Grab your friends and your flashlight, so you’ll be prepared to collect egg-citing prizes at the annual teen only egg hunt. Will you walk away with a boogie board or a TV? Come to the event and find out! Dancing and music start at 8pm, egg hunt at 8:30pm. Everyone will be eligible for community service hours needed for school. #ThisParkIsHoppin
  1. Apr 13

  2. Construction Vocational Training Program

    The Construction Vocational Training program will equip you with the knowledge, skills, and experience necessary to gain employment in the construction industry, especially as it applies to the carpentry specialization. The course meets for four hours on Saturday for 12 weeks beginning February the 2nd and ending on April the 27th. We will focus on principles of construction carpentry and specific skills and tools use necessary to be successful in the industry. Participants will also gain skills...

  3. Second Saturday at the Temecula Valley Museum

    For April's Second Saturday cultural celebration, the Temecula Valley Museum will be honoring The Netherlands, in which the City of Temecula's Sister City Leidschendam-Voorburg is located. Enjoy refreshments, crafts, and a special art lesson by Tony Moramarco of Bigfoot Graphics. The national holiday in the Kingdom of The Netherlands, King's Day (which occurs on April 27th), serves as the inspiration of this event. This holiday is held in honor of the King's birthday and is celebrated through...

  4. Speakeasy at The Merc

    Each second Saturday of the month, Speakeasy at The Merc presents live Traditional Jazz of the 20s-40s. Performances feature the house band, Second Hand Jazz with vocalist Rosalie Porter, in rotation with prominent southern California Traditional Jazz artists.

  5. All Shook Up

    Elvis Presley Music Book by Joe DiPietro Through Special Arrangement with Theatrical Rights Worldwide 2019 An American jukebox musical featuring the songs of Elvis Presley and based on William Shakespeare's play Twelfth Night. It’s 1955, and into a square little town in a square little state rides a guitar-playing young man who changes everything and everyone he meets in this hip-swiveling, lip-curling musical fantasy that’ll have you jumpin’ out of your blue suede shoes with such classics...
  1. Apr 14

  2. All Shook Up

It’s 1955, and into a square little town in a square little state rides a guitar-playing young man who changes everything and everyone he meets in this hip-swiveling, lip-curling musical fantasy that’ll have you jumpin’ out of your blue suede shoes with such classics...

  3. CLASSICS AT THE MERC

    Presented by California Chamber Orchestra association with Temecula Presents Classics at The Merc is a bi-monthly chamber recital series co-produced by the California Chamber Orchestra and Temecula Presents. Every 2nd and 4th Sunday afternoon we feature an individual musician or small ensemble performing a wide range of music. Our performers are all working professional musicians or advanced conservatory students. The Classics at The Merc series is curated by Michael Molnau...
  1. Apr 15

  2. Temecula Business Week

    Temecula Business Week is a free, five-day celebration of our community that builds momentum and opportunity around entrepreneurship. We’re led by local entrepreneurs and hosted in amazing spaces all over town. We want you involved! For more detailed information and to register, please visit temeculabusinessweek2019.sched.com. For any questions, please contact Brandi Bemoll at brandi.bemoll@temeculaca.gov.

  3. RHRTPL Movie Night

    Grades 7-12. No advance registration. Space is limited. Bring your friends and we'll bring the snacks! Get ready for an epic movie night!
